text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A woman lives on the 20th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning, she takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
In the evening, when she returns, she takes the elevator to the 10th floor and then walks up the stairs for the remaining 10 floors to her apartment.
However, on rainy days or when there are other people in the elevator, she takes the elevator directly to the 20th floor.

Why does she do this? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Okay, so I'm trying to figure out why this woman takes the elevator down every morning and then, in the evening, goes up to the 10th floor and walks the rest.
But on rainy days or when there are others in the elevator, she goes straight to the 20th floor.
Hmm, maybe it's about the number of people in the elevator affecting her route.
Let me break it down.
In the morning, she goes from the 20th floor to the ground floor.
So she takes the elevator down.
Now, in the evening, when she's coming back, she takes the elevator up to the 10th floor.
Why just the 10th? Maybe because she doesn't want to deal with too many people in the elevator, so she stops at the 10th floor and then walks up the stairs.
But wait, why doesn't she just take the elevator all the way? Maybe because when she takes the elevator, if there are other people in it, she goes to the 20th floor.
So perhaps she's avoiding riding with others, so she gets off at the 10th floor and walks up.
That makes sense because she doesn't want to be in the elevator with others, especially on rainy days when maybe more people are using it.
So, the key here is that she changes her route based on how many people are in the elevator.
If there are others, she takes the elevator all the way up.
If not, she stops at the 10th floor and walks the rest.
That way, she avoids waiting or dealing with others in the elevator, saving herself time or effort.
I think that's it.
She's optimizing her routine to minimize inconvenience, so she adjusts her elevator stops based on whether she's sharing it with others.

</think>

The woman adjusts her elevator usage based on the number of people in it.
When others are present, she takes the elevator directly to her floor to avoid sharing the space.
On rainy days or when the elevator is empty, she uses it all the way.
If there are no others, she goes to the 10th floor and walks up the stairs.
This way, she minimizes inconvenience and optimizes her routine.
